timeline.bodyText:
I heart of grok for the first time today, but anyway, isn't patterns/patterns a typo?
Regardless whether it is correct, wouldn't it be worthwhile to document the path?
Shouldn't the itest cover it somehow (I cannot see patterns/patterns folder in the itest)?
timeline.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for raising @ppalaga.
camel-grok comes with what the camel doc calls predefined patterns, under the hood it's java-grok default patterns. Grok default patterns includes things like mac, ip, number and so on.
That said, patterns/patterns may be a bit vague but is not under our control. The test coverage must be correct as we are using mac, ip and so on in itests. Concerning the doc, I would let it in camel, maybe just clarify the predefined patterns section.
WDYT ?
replies.author: aldettinger

replies.bodyText: Oh, I see, so, patterns/patterns is not intended to be used by end users, right? All is fine then. Thanks for explaining.
replies.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: Not for end user indeed. Thanks for asking, this exchange will help me to improve the camel doc a bit and may help users in the future.
replies.author: aldettinger
